name: Boot Camp Simulations
description:
In a utopian society, a century of peace is threatened by ghosts of the past.

The year is 2140, and the world has had to fundamentally reclaim humanity after a catastrophic event. However, helped by a mysterious faction, the violent legacy of our ancestors rears its ugly head, threatening to relapse humanity back into the 21st century.

Amid all of this, you are just someone running through a series of virtual simulations. Apparently.

Welcome to RayTech's proprietary Boot Camp Simulations!

Weird, experimental first-person shooter with a sci-fi narrative woven through it.

Play Length:

15 minutes

Controls

WASD to Move

Left-mouse button to interact, right-mouse for scope when available.

R to reload.

Notes:

First thing I've made and put out to public in over three years. It's not much but hopefully an end to a cycle of self-doubt and projects that go nowhere.

This was made for the 7DFPS game jam.

It isn't optimized but should run OK if you have 8GB or more of RAM.

No Mac version sadly, as I don't have the means or ability to build this game for OSX anymore.

Any feedback or comments are welcome and appreciated.

I might come back to this in a few weeks and flesh out some of its ideas a bit more.
